definition: dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: The Little Mermaid is one of Anderson's more moving fairytales.
sentences.chinese: “美人鱼”是安徒生比较感人的童话故事之一。

sentences.english: Some readers will recall the fairy story of Rumpelstiltskin.
sentences.chinese: 有些读者可能会想起童话故事《侏儒怪》。

sentences.english: Magdalene is about work — not miracles, not fairy tales.
sentences.chinese: 抹大拉从良所意味着工作，没有奇迹，没有童话故事。

sentences.english: Perhaps some fairy tales are more grounded in reality than others.
sentences.chinese: 也许一些童话故事更符合实际一些。

sentences.english: Momotaro as a child to see the justice over evil fairy tale.
sentences.chinese: 小时候看的桃太郎是正义战胜邪恶的童话故事。

sentences.english: We beguiled the children with fairy tales.
sentences.chinese: 我们以童话故事使儿童娱乐。

sentences.english: Please retell the fairy story in English.
sentences.chinese: 请用英语复述这篇童话故事。

sentences.english: One of the most exciting objects found in fairy tales is the flying carpet.
sentences.chinese: 飞毯是童话故事中最令人称奇的物品之一。

sentences.english: Anderson, in the beautiful fairy tale and found his own kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 安德森，在美丽的童话故事，发现他自己的王国。

sentences.english: It turns out that the fairy tales come true.
sentences.chinese: 结果是这一切童话故事都成真了。

sentences.english: This is a fairy tale full of childishness and playfulness.
sentences.chinese: 这是一部充满童趣的童话故事。

sentences.english: When looked at closely, all children's stories communicate simple views on good and evil.
sentences.chinese: 细细考量，童话故事传递的是最朴素的善恶观。

sentences.english: But one author has written an entire book on how she believes the fairytale fantasies send a dangerous message.
sentences.chinese: 但有作家写了本书，认为童话故事会教坏小朋友。

sentences.english: The poem is a fairy tale.
The romantic love, is the beautiful fairy tale story.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫的爱情，是美丽的童话故事。

sentences.english: This application contains Grimm's brother fairy tales in simplified Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 本包含格林兄弟儿童童话故事。

pinyin: Ai4 li4 si1 Man4 you2 Qi2 jing4 Ji4

definition: The Chronicles of Narnia, children's stories by C.S. Lewis
Wild Swans, family autobiography by British-Chinese writer Jung Chang 張戎|张戎[Zhang1 Rong2]/alternative title 鴻|鸿, after the author's original name 張二鴻|张二鸿[Zhang1 Er4 hong2]
Winnie-the-Pooh (bear character in children's stories by A. A. Milne adapted by Disney)
